reasoning: Stimulant dependence (cocaine, amphetamine) incidence estimated at 40-50 per 100k globally. Prevalence of stimulant use disorder estimated at 140-160 per 100k based on WHO Global Burden of Disease and UNODC data. Using middle estimates of 45 incidence and 150 prevalence.
source: Degenhardt L et al. (2008). Global epidemiology and burden of heroin use and dependence: likely causes of differences in burden. Drug Alcohol Depend. 98(3):147-160
